intro: Hymenidium cristatum, commonly known as the cristate liverwort, is a small, terrestrial liverwort belonging to the family Peltasporaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, leafy structure and a distinctive, crest-like arrangement of leaves that give it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, known as sorocarps, are borne on stalks and contain spores for propagation. Hymenidium cristatum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
